intro: Psychotria reptans, commonly known as the "Coral Root" or "Green Psychotria," is a tropical flowering plant belonging to the Rubiaceae family. It is native to Central and South America, particularly found in humid, shaded forest understories. The plant is characterized by its small, dark green leaves and clusters of tiny, white or pale pink flowers. It has a unique ability to absorb nutrients through its roots, often growing in nutrient-poor soils. Psychotria reptans is also noted for its use in traditional medicine and as a source of alkaloids.
